TeamOrange.instantmessenger

Class App

  • java.lang.Object
    • TeamOrange.instantmessenger.App

  • public class App
extends java.lang.Object
    Top level of the application, creates and connects objects, determines architecture. This is not the starting point of the application, because JavaFX wants the starting point to be a view class that extends Application. The staring point is GuiBase, which sets up JavaFX, then creates an instance of this class.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()

      • messageListener

        public void messageListener(AppMessage message)
        This function is called by BabblerBase when there is a new message event If the message type is NORMAL, then it is handled accordingly Otherwise if the message type is CHAT, then it is passed to the chatController, along with a variable representing if the current screen is the chat screen.
        Parameters:
        message - the new message

      • presenceListener

        public void presenceListener(AppJid fromJid,
                             AppPresence.Type appPresenceType)
        This is called by BabblerBase when there is a new presence event
        Parameters:
        fromJid - the appJid that the presence is from
        appPresenceType - the type of the new presence

      • rosterListener

        public void rosterListener()
        This is called by BabblerBase when there is a new roster event

      • connectionEventListener

        public void connectionEventListener(ConnectionEventEnum type)
        This is called by babblerBase when a new connection event occurs.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of event

      • setScreen

        public void setScreen(ScreenEnum screen)
        changes the current screen, and updates guiBase accordingly. Certain screens are required to load some input when they are changed to. Set Screen to current View.
        Parameters:
        screen -
